Legal_Issue: Whether the immigration officer's decision violated procedural fairness or failed to follow relevant guidelines
Application_Facts: Applicant faced marital violence; sponsorship withdrawn due to marital breakdown; claimed officer ignored humanitarian guidelines
Court_Ruling: No breach of procedural fairness; officer considered disproportionate hardship; decision upheld
Defendant_Behavior: Immigration officer denied landing; considered hardship but did not follow non-binding guidelines
Grounds_for_Claim: Marital breakdown, domestic violence, withdrawal of sponsorship
Legal_Standard: Administrative decisions must observe procedural fairness
Procedural_Issue: Alleged failure to follow procedural fairness in decision-making
Application_Basis: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds for landing
Evidence_Assessed: Nature and severity of domestic violence
Possibility of returning to home country
Governing_Rule: Guidelines in the Immigration Manual are non-binding recommendations
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm from returning to home country due to domestic violence
Cause_Description: Marital breakdown and domestic violence led to loss of sponsorship and denial of entry on humanitarian grounds
Evidence_Handling: Applicant was given opportunity to present her case
Evidence_Assessment: Officer assessed whether return would cause disproportionate hardship
Decision_Rationale: Procedural fairness observed; guidelines not binding; decision within acceptable range
